messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a very positive article on unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: How cool!  David Bowie!! I ve written to and have replies from one of the authors of Laurel s Kitchen Bread Book and from the woman who does the For Better or
messages.messageBody:
How cool! David Bowie!!

I've written to and have replies from one of the authors of Laurel's Kitchen
Bread Book and from the woman who does the For Better or Worse comic strip.

I also have Jack Lemon's autograph (~1978), but don't have any way to prove
that it really is his.

Mary Ellen

messages.subject: Re: a very positive article on unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: That was very cool Sandra! I was quite a fan of his back-in-the day...seen him in concert twice (late 70 s and then again in the mid 80 s). ~ Joanne ~ Mom to
messages.messageBody:
That was very cool Sandra!
I was quite a fan of his back-in-the day...seen him in concert twice
(late 70's and then again in the mid '80's).

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/
http://foreverparents.com

Sorry. I just made up that address and then went to double check but
forgot to repair the e-mail. I'm not having good link-luck today.

And to top it all off, my site search quit working.

(But my yard is blooming and getting green, so I haven't been working
on webpages as much as before.)

Lifeï¿½s a Snap
The Pitch Wed, 12 Apr 2006 12:22 PM PDT
School's nearly out for the summer, so the teacher asks which of her
second-graders will be back next year. Everyone is returning except
for Zach Van Benthusen....

They might enjoy seeing that.

Sandra
